## How to create and manage courses?

Joe is a staff in an organisation and he has been assigned as the programme
admin in Curricula. He is responsible for preparing courses for trainers and
learners.

Joe can create the following types of courses in Curricula:

• Blended course – A blended course combines online learning materials and
opportunities for interaction online with traditional place-based classroom
methods.

• Self-paced course – A self-paced course allows learners to complete the
course at their own pace.

Let’s see how Joe will create and manage courses in Curricula.

#### Create blended courses

In Curricula, Joe clicks **Admin** on the left navigation pane, and then
clicks **Course configuration**.

1\. In the **Blended courses** tab, he clicks **Create course** and then
selects **Create course**.

2\. Joe uploads the course image and fills in the course information.

Note the following:

• Each course belongs to a programme. Joe can select a previously configured
programme. If he wants to add a new programme, he can navigate to **Programme
configurations** to create a new one.

• Depending on the course type, the course may require a venue. If a venue is
required, Joe can navigate to **Venue management** to create a venue.

3\. Joe clicks **Save and release** to save the course and release the course
to the course manager. If he wants to release the course later, he can click
**Save**.

#### Create self-paced courses

1\. In Curricula, Joe clicks **Admin** on the left navigation pane, and then
clicks **Course configuration**.

2\. He clicks the **Self-paced courses** tab, clicks **Create course** , and
then selects **Create course**.

3\. Joe uploads the course image and fills in the course information.

***Note** : Each course belongs to a programme. Joe can select a previously
configured programme. If he wants to add a new programme, he can navigate to
**Programme configurations** to create a new one.

4\. Joe clicks **Save and release** to save the course and release the course
to the course manager. If he wants to release the course later, he can click
**Save**.

#### Enrol learners to courses

1\. Joe selects the course and clicks **Manage enrolled learners**.

2\. He clicks **Add learner**.

3\. In the **Address book** window, Joe can select users or Microsoft Entra
groups.

4\. When Joe finishes the learner enrolment, he clicks **Add**.

When the learner enrolment is finished and the course is released, the
assigned course manager can configure classes, sessions, learning paths, and
learning objects for the course. If Joe wants to configure these, he can
select the course, click **Configure** , and then refer to the instructions in
How to add course content and publish to learners?.

***Note** : When a Microsoft Entra group is enrolled to a course, all existing
group members and newly added group members will be enrolled to the course.
Once the course is overdue, Curricula for Corporate Learning will stop syncing
Microsoft Entra group members to that course, so that users newly added to the
Microsoft Entra group will not be enrolled to the overdue course. If the end
time of the course is extended later, Curricula for Corporate Learning will
sync the user updates during the time period.

#### What if Joe wants to reuse an existing course?

Joe’s organisation provides recurrence courses for different batch of
learners. They want to reuse the content of an existing course, so they don’t
need to repeat the configurations of classes, sessions, learning paths, etc.

Now let’s see how Joe can duplicate a course in Curricula.

1\. Joe selects a course and clicks **Duplicate**.

2\. In the **Duplicate course** panel, Joe can see that the new course will
use the same course code and the suffix **\- Copy** is added to the course
name. He can modify the course name.

3\. For a blended course, Joe needs to select the start time and end time for
the course. For a self-paced course, Joe can select the end time.

4\. He selects the **Copy course content to the new course** checkbox.

**Category** |  **What will be copied?** |  **What will not be copied?**  
---|---|---  
Blended course |  Classes, including class owners |  Learners in classes  
Sessions, including trainers |  Session time  
Learning paths |  Topics in discussion forum  
Content groups |  Surveys  
Learning objects, including markers |  Settings  
Files in staff workbin  
Self-paced course |  Learning objects, including markers |  Learners  
Settings  
Topics in discussion forum  
  
5\. Joe clicks **Save and edit it now** to procced to edit the course
information.
